page.title: 08Home Life and Housing.
page.content: Most of the houses are lived in all year because the people of Maidencombe are home loving.They are lived in by the owner not rented from a landlord. There are a few new houses.They fit in quite well because they are built in the traditional way.They are mostly made of brick and stone.They have a slate or tiled roof.Some are thatched. There was a court house that was turned into a hotel and farm house which is a normal house now.The houses at Watcombe Heights and Petitor are detached and very large.Some have been turned into flats.There is a select block of flats where old people live. Maidencombe villagers do not rise very early and keep to a reasonable bed time.They enjoy relaxing at home and gardening.Most are retired so they take life easy.
